Center: IAEA Nuclear Data Section, Vienna, Austria
title: Excitation Function For 15O Production Via the 14N(d,n)15O Reaction

x4freetext: Excitation Function For 15O Production Via the
14N(d,n)15O Reaction

x4codes.hlp: Brookhaven National Laboratory, Upton, NY, United States of America

x4freetext: chemistry department
1st author`s present address,(1980).
The cross sections were calculated from measured
disintegration rates, the number of target nuclei and
the number of incident deuterons per unit time.
Nitrogen gas contained in quartz cells (2 cm i.d., 3 to
5 cm long) with aluminum foil windows (21.51 mg/cm2).
nitrogen gas filled at pressures from 200 to 400 torr.

x4codes.hlp: Brookhaven National Laboratory, Upton, NY, United States of America

x4freetext: Number of deuterons striking the target was measured
Beam intensities were in the range of 70 to 130 NA with
typical irradiation times of 10 to 20 sec. the total
using a Faraday cup.
saturation method.
well-type Nai(Tl) scintillation counter with a 62 perc.
efficiency for 511 keV photons.
The efficiency was calibrated for C-11 by counting
polyethylene foils which has been irradiated with
protons (C-12(p,pn)C-11).
at energies low than 4 to 5 MeV, the contribution of
N-13 from N-14(d,nd)N-13 to the total activity is very
small( less than 0.03 percent).
data taken from table 1 of Radiochimica Acta,24(1977)65
